::KitKat::

She smiled at him. "Quickstrike was the second in command when I 
joined up with the pack. So I don't know mush about him before that.  
I do now that he is like a wolf, looking after his pups.  He tries to 
take care of us." She looked at Rowdy. "He's more like a friend than 
anything else. But he is a great leader." She didn't understand why 
she was talking this way about her commander like this. But she felt 
like it was the truth. So she spoke it.  She just hoped that she 
wouldn't regret it.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Talon Harvilicz" <wilddance_mare@h...> 
wrote:
> Rowdy Wolf:
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Rowdy Wolf held back a laugh from KitKat's question. It seemed to 
be the 
> main thing he had to explain. "I don't know where I came from." he 
replied. 
> "All I can remember is coming on-line to a barren place. I traveled 
until I 
> found somewhere I could make a home of. I was alone. I stayed that 
way for a 
> long time, until I found Quickstrike in my territory." He wasn't 
sure if he 
> should tell her he attacked him. "He told me about the Predacons. I 
agreed 
> to stay in my territory until he needed me. Now, I guess he needs 
me." He 
> shook his head while in motion. "Tell me, how did Quickstrike 
become second 
> in command?"
>
